name: Residence Inn Anaheim Resort Area

reviews.text: Stayed here from December 22 through 30th. My entire family celebrated the holidays booking 3 suites for both sets of grandparents, siblings, couples and grandchildren. The full-size kitchens are great for such a family celebration and there are plenty of restaurants within walking distance. There is also an excellent supermarket with 1/2 mile(Von's) to purchase groceries.
reviews.title: Good place for families

likes.disliked: — slow elevator service, halways, elevators not cleaned in one week of stay

reviews.text: Be prepared, though, the breakfast-although excellent given it is complimentary-is mobbed and noisy. They do an excellent job keeping up with cleaning tables and replenishing the food tables. I found it surprisingly quiet in the evening in spite of the number of folks and lots of children staying at the hotel.
reviews.title: worth it with 3 kids

reviews.text: I would recommend this for families only. Couples on their own may not enjoy it. There is a lovely Hyatt right next door that may be more suitable.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel!!

likes.liked: — Location, complimentary breakfast and hospitality time

reviews.text: Stayed here Dec 27-30 06. Booked it a day ahead and chose it because it had the bunk beds and sofa bed, and 2 bathrooms and most places within walking distance of Disneyland were full. I would stay there again because it was a great value. The parking and then driving to and parking at disneyland was not a hassle. We used the mickey and friends lot and the trams ran continuously. We didn't use the kitchen or pool facilities and stayed at Disneyland until midnight every night. The breakfast was fine for us, and yes, by 8:30 breakfast was crowded and they were out of food, but replenished within a few minutes (thought they wouldn't based on reviews, and left prematurely). We only used the shuttle once, and it was good but we did have to wait 30 min for it. Of course there were lots of kids, everybody staying there was going to Disneyland.
reviews.title: Good location, but ONLY for families

reviews.text: My family stayed at this hotel from Oct 31-Nov9, 2006. This truely was a home away from home experience. The staff were extremely helpful and kind. The beds and pillows were heavenly. When we arrived on Halloween they had the breakfast area all decorated with black and orange balloons and for the snack that night they had chocolate dipped bananas with a variety of different sprinkles and caramel apples. Well my kids were in heaven. The breakfast's in the morning were delicious. Try having the potatoes with cheese sauce on top and green onions. My husbands favorite. This is the perfect hotel to stay if you are travelling with children. They show movies on Thursday nights, and every evening from 5pm till 7pm they have a snack or you can call it supper if you like. While we were there we only caught it a couple of times as we were usually at the park until it closed. They had Mac n Cheese one night, nachos another night, raviolli, chili etc. So basically you can have breakfast and supper for free if you choose and all you would have to pay for is a lunch??
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for families close to Disney.

likes.liked: — The great convenient location. The spacious suite.

reviews.text: We recently stayed for four nights in a two bedroom, two bath unit #829. We had three adults and three kids and paid $289/night. One bedroom had two queen beds (Embassy Suites is usually a full) and one had a king bed. The room is on the top floor of the hotel at the end of wing that runs parallel to Harbor Blvd. Partly due to the location at the end of the wing and partly due to being on the top floor this was one of the quietest hotels we have stayed at. Very little noise from neighboring rooms, and limited street noise. The closest neighboring hotels are the Embassy Suites and Hyatt Regency, with quite a few more on the same block or next block.
reviews.title: Excellent Place To Stay

reviews.text: The room was spacious and well laid out, walls painted in a nice light yellow - very cheerful. The property is only about three years old and everything is in excellent condition. Outside there is a bbq area (byofood) a pool, a 1 ft. deep kiddie pool (unheated) and a spa. The breakfast is not as good as Embassy Suites but adequate. Scrambled eggs, pancakes, potatos, waffles, fruit, juice, cereal, oatmeal, toast, bagels.
reviews.title: Great family hotel

likes.disliked: — 4 blocks may be too far to walk to Disneyland for the little ones

reviews.text: Small nitpicks - houskeeping was not as thorough as I expected and a squeaky door was never lubricated after I called the front desk. The two elevators were not speedy enough during busy breakfast hours and one of the elevators was broken for a short time while we were there. The parking spaces for registration are not well marked and look like regular parking spaces.
reviews.title: Good Location, convenient to everything!

likes.disliked: — Wait time for Elevators to rooms can be a problem

reviews.title: Would recommend this hotel for families
reviews.text: The hotel is about two miles south of Disneyland, too far to walk. We chose to drive and park instead of taking the public shuttle. If you do drive and arrive early enough, park at the Timon parking lot (Harbor Blvd. north and left at Disney Way) instead of the gargantuan Mickey and Friends Structure which while well laid out is further from the hotel. If you do park at Mickey and Friends, the top level might be the best place to view the fireworks outside of the park.
There are lots of choices of places to stay near Disneyland, this has got to be one of the best.
reviews.title: You won't be disappointed!
Excellent Hotel - though a bit far from Disneyland
reviews.text: We have stayed in this particular hotel twice in the last year. During both stays, we were very pleased with the overall cleanliness, quality and accessibility of the hotel. However if you are in Anaheim/Garden Grove area just to visit Disneyland, please account for the fact that this property is about 1.5 miles away.

reviews.title: Very Nice Stay at the Residence Inn
reviews.text: The complimentary breakfast in the morning provides for an excellent start! They have hot scrambled eggs, potatoes, waffle irons, fresh pancakes, bagels, toast, fresh fruit etc. We always load up on breakfast before heading out to the park. My kids loved that they had fruit loops available!! Most excellent!

reviews.title: Just average, okay.
reviews.text: This is also an all-suite hotel, which means that each room comes with a full kitchen. Very useful when we wanted to have a home cooked meal after 2-3 days of eating out! If you are planning on cooking in your room, remember that the hotel has complimentary grocery shopping service. Fill out a list of things that you need and drop it off at the front desk by 9:00 and they will be delivered to your room the same day! Pretty convenient!

reviews.title: Good Hotel for Families
reviews.text: We just returned from a 6 night stay at the Residence Inn Garden Grove. We had a blast. Check in was very smooth. When the desk clerk gave us our keys to our 2 bedroom/2 bath (bunkbed) suite, I went up to the room to check it out while the hubby un packed (we arrived at midnight). The bunkbed is more for a child under 10 or so (we had a 4 year old and a tall 15 year old with us), the sofa back was spotted or should I say soiled, no closet in kids room and the bathtub had some mold around it. I immediately went to the front desk and told them what the problem was. The clerk immediately apologized for any inconvenience the hotel had caused and told me I would be upgraded to the 2/2 bath with the king and two queens instead at no charge and gave us a night free of charge as well. I was very happy with this suite. There is definitely enough space for the kids and adults (as I might go to sleep early and the hubby can still watch tv in the living room without bothering the kids or me which is great). Beds are very comfortable and both baths are a good size with tubs in both as well. The kitchen has everything you need too.

reviews.title: Awesome hotel for families!!
reviews.text: The complimentary breakfast has everything you need to get started - loved it (but can get crowded fast but they replenish very fast and they are very nice as well). We has so much fun in the pool and jacuzzi (nice temperature) but the kiddie pool was freezing. This pool really needs to be heated as soon as possible. It's too cold for anybody - even an eskimo. Loved the basketball court area as well. Today upon checkout, the elevators were down and we had to use the service elevator - not a problem as every other day was fine. I would definitely return to the residence inn.

Just returned from a weekend stay at the Residence. Very good hotel for the price. I had a 1 bedroom suite, which was plenty of room for my son and myself. On the 2nd night my niece stayed in my room on the sofa bed and I agree with the other posters that say it is very cramped when the sofabed is out. You have to climb over the bed because there is no room between it and the TV. Other than that, the room was very nice. Bedding and carpets were clean. There were a few stray hairs in the shower and bathroom sink. I did not utilize the kitchen, other than using the microwave, but it was well stocked with all the supplies you would need and they were clean and in good condition. No issues with housekeeping, room was clean when I returned in the evening on both days.
reviews.title: Good experience at the Residence
Not Again
reviews.text: The free breakfast had plenty of choices-cereal, fruit, muffins, eggs, sausage, potatoes etc. I liked the make-your-own-waffle stations. I would suggest getting up early and going right when it opens. I did that on both days and was glad I did. I left for Disneyland both days around 8:30-9 and as I walked by the dining area it was packed. I noticed several people waiting for the staff to bring out more food and there were no more seats available.

reviews.title: Comfortable. Felt right at home from the start.
reviews.text: I did not notice any real slow down with the elevators. Although I was not there mid day so I cannot say how it was then. We left fairly early and came back fairly late. The hotel provides free internet however mine was not working. I brought the laptop just to check email and it did not work. However since it was not anything real important I did not make a stink about it. On Fridays and Saturdays the hotel shows a movie for the kids. I did not use the pool so cannot comment on that.

The parking lot is a little on the small side. I was able to get a good spot close to the entrance and left my car there the entire time. If the parking lot gets full you'll have to park at the Hyatt next door. We utilized the ART shuttle while there. Tickets are $3 a day. They are supposed to run every 20 mins so they say, but they always seemed to running late. The shuttle stop is right outside the Residence on the side of the building. Very convenient for those that don't want to drive their car or take a taxi.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!!

reviews.text: There are some dining choices around the hotel. Outback and Red Robin. There are also some fast food places. We ate at Red Robin one night and the service there was great, very fast. There is also a Target which can come in handy if you forgot anything at home.
reviews.title: Good for Business & Families

aka: Residence Inn Anaheim Resort Area Hotel Garden Grove
description: Our extended stay Anaheim Resort Area suites are so well equipped and fully furnished, you’ll never have to set up house twice. Tastefully decorated, our guest suites are as comfortable as they are clean. With all the amenities to make your stay enjoyable and convenient they are the perfect home away from home. We offer a mix of 200 suites that fit your every need. Our suites feature a king or two queen beds and queen-sized sofa sleeper with a large living area and full kitchen. Two-bedroom kid's suites feature a bunk bed in a separate second bedroom. A queen sofa sleeper is available in the living area adjacent to the kitchen. All suites offer complimentary high-speed Internet and fully equipped kitchens. In our Anaheim Resort Area Suites we Offer:• Coffee and Tea Makers• Complimentary High-Speed Internet Access• Dual Line Phones with Voice Mail and Wake-up Service• Full Kitchens with Stove, Microwave, Toaster, Refrigerator and more• Hairdryer• Individual Climate Control• Iron and Ironing Board• Kids Suites Available w/ Bunkbeds• Pillow Choice (Feather Down/Foam)• Pool Views from 50% of the Rooms• Sofa Beds• Silverware, Pots, Pans, Serving Dishes, etc.• Work Stations with Lamp.
